info.title: Consent
info.description: This external API will offer the ability to insert, retrieve and delete Consent information for Barclays customers.

post.description: Validate Authorised Consent for Account Request Initiation - The purpose of this API operation is to validate that consent has already been authorised for the Account Request Initiation details now being executed, by cross-checking that the request details match those stored on the Authorised Consent tables in the Barclays Consent database.   Previously the TPP must have sent the Payment Initiation details on behalf of the customer and the customer must have then authorised the consent using the Identity Provider application.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

schema.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being provided in the request.

schema.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being provided in the request.

get.description: Read Account Request Consent Status - retrieves the status of an existing consent for a TPP to retrieve account details.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

schema.description: The unique id of the ASPSP to which the request is issued. The unique id will be issued by OB.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-last-logged-time
parameters.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

schema.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: AccountRequestId
parameters.description: The unique consent identifier for this TPP and account retrieval initiation request, which will have been passed back to the TPP on account request initiation. This identifier will also be used for subsequent linking to the customer and authorisation to proceed with the account details retrieval by the TPP.  In Barclays, the format will be BARCLAYS-A-nnnnnnnnnnnnnn where A means an account request consent and nnnnnnnnnnnnnn is a 14 digit number. Referred to as the AccountRequestId in the industry specification.

delete.description: Revoke Account Request Consent - revoke an existing consent to retrieve account details for a customer and TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-financial-id
parameters.description: The unique id, as issued by Open Banking, of the account / payment servicing provider (i.e. Barclays) to which the request is issued.

schema.description: The unique id, as issued by Open Banking, of the account / payment servicing provider (i.e. Barclays) to which the request is issued.

parameters.name: AccountRequestId
parameters.description: The unique consent identifier for this TPP and account retrieval initiation request, which will have been passed back to the TPP on account request initiation. This identifier will also be used for subsequent linking to the customer and authorisation to proceed with the account details retrieval by the TPP.  In Barclays, the format will be BARCLAYS-A-nnnnnnnnnnnnnn where A means an account request consent and nnnnnnnnnnnnnn is a 14 digit number. Referred to as the AccountRequestId in the industry specification.

post.description: Validate Authorised Consent for Payment Submission - The purpose of this API operation is to validate that consent has already been authorised for the Payment Submission details now being executed, by cross-checking that the payment details being submitted match those stored on the Authorised Consent tables in the Barclays Consent database.   Previously the TPP must have sent the Payment Initiation details on behalf of the customer and the customer must have then authorised the consent using the Identity Provider application (e.g. ROLB or BMB).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being provided in the request.   This must be set to application/json.

schema.description: Standard HTTP Header; Represents the format of the payload being provided in the request.   This must be set to application/json.

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Custom HTTP Header; Unique request identifier to support idempotency. Every request will be processed only once per x-idempotency-key.  The Idempotency Key will be valid for 24 hours.

schema.description: Custom HTTP Header; Unique request identifier to support idempotency. Every request will be processed only once per x-idempotency-key.  The Idempotency Key will be valid for 24 hours.
